page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: Two well equipped playgroups cater for children aged 3-5years.Built in 1929, the Primary school originally had a hall,6 classrooms,offices and staff- room.In 1979,3 classrooms,a kitchen, new toilets and a modern hall with PE equipment were added.Original class rooms were extended to add art and quiet areas.The school now has 367 children aged 5-12 with 11 teachers plus head.3 mobile classrooms are now needed.There is a welcoming atmosphere with colourful displays of childrens work every where.The curriculum is based on learning by experience and subjects are combined in Topic work. Maths skills,language and reading are highly valued and children enjoy music painting,printing and sewing.Many activities are enjoyed in the grounds. At 11 years,pupils transfer to Alec Hunter Comprehensive in Braintree.
